abstracts.cdata!:
The Water Sector Performance Improvement
            Project for Zambia had a moderately satisfactory outcome,
            with both the performances of the Bank and the borrower
            being deemed moderately satisfactory as well. While most of
            the project development outcome indicators and the
            intermediate outcome indicators were fully achieved, there
            were two indicators that were achieved only partially. The
            efficiency of the project was felt to be substantial.
            Significant lessons learned during the implementation of the
            project are: 1) the effectiveness of performance contracts
            as a tool to improve service delivery; 2) the need for
            vigilance on quality of designs and appropriate contract
            packaging; 3) a need for early involvement of stakeholders
            for timely completion of works; and 4) assigning qualified
            and dedicated contract management staff for large contracts
            by the government.
